intro: Alectra dentata, commonly known as the toothed alectra, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Alectra dentata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
